newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Grains Council supports AWB restructure model.
newsitem.headline: Grains Council supports AWB restructure model.

text.p: The wheat committee of Grains Council of Australia has reaffirmed support for its model of the restructured Australian Wheat Board (AWB).
The committee resolved at the Grains Week '97 conference to support the model agreed to in early March and recommended to the Minister for Primary Industries and Energy.

The model provides for retention of the single export desk, grower ownership and control, an adequate capital base for maintaining the system of harvest payments, commercial flexibility and industry self-determination.
The committee opposed any breakup of the package of proposals contained in the model.
The committee's resolution stated that the proposal was a total package and would need to be considered as such by the government.
If the proposal were not accepted in full, the wheat committee may have to reconsider its position, it said.
The recommendation of the committee will be forwarded to the full Grains Council for consideration on Friday.
